ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were making large mouthfuls. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not make a mouthful that’s too large,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.4_0: he should not make a mouthful that’s too large;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes a large mouthful, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.13_0: if it is a special curry;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.16_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.17_0: The ninth training rule is finished.
